sources.title: Quality Street (1927)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, along with other pictures of the era that I find interesting, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Though the Katherine Hepburn version is more well remembered today, the original Quality Street adaptation was a critical hit as well. Unfortunately, the box office did not match that acclaim, and it was one of star Marion Davies lowest grossing films. Davies plays a woman who waits years for her suitor to return from war, only for him to think that the years have not been kind to her.

metadata.Plot: A young British doctor leaves his fiancé to go off and fight in the Napoleonic wars. Upon his return ten years later, he finds the the beautiful young girl he knew is now a tired, aging schoolteacher and he is no longer interested in her. She is still in love with him, however, and rather than give him up, she "reinvents" herself as her younger, perkier "niece" Livvy and tries to regain his interest.
metadata.Writer: Marian Ainslee, J.M. Barrie, Ruth Cummings
metadata.Actors: Marion Davies, Conrad Nagel, Helen Jerome Eddy
